title: [BEAM-3845] Remove deprecated Class.newInstance() method usage
body:
`Class.newInstance()` is deprecated since Java 9. See more verbose description on Jira. I searched for all `Class.newInstance()` usages in Beam's codebase and It seems that this was the only one usage of `Class.newInstance()` in beam codebase left. :) Other places that require the new instance use either `Constructor.newInstance()` or `Class.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance()`. Both replacements are acceptable and are not deprecated in Java 9. @iemejia could you take a look? ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7629] Go SDK: Refactoring fn order validation (INCOMPLETE)
body:
Refactoring how Fn parameter and return value order validation works. title: [BEAM-8233] [BEAM-8214] [BEAM-8232] Document environment_type flag
body:
We've gotten a lot of questions about this on the mailing list, particularly from new users, so hopefully this makes things a bit easier. - Use loopback for getting started; don't require a docker build. - Explain the differences between the different values for `environment_type`. - Remove runner-specific wordcount instructions from the portability page. The runner documentation pages should be the source of truth for those. title: Restore portable schema changes, with simple LogicalType support
body:
Un-reverts changes to the portable schema representation, with a couple of changes (https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/22f38527799f0863d74ee3d1e92011be2fd72c28): - Changes the LogicalType string args to a byte payload - Supports encoding arbitrary Java SDK LogicalTypes with the `beam:fieldtype:javasdk` URN. Long-term I would like to move types to a registry and discourage this URN ([BEAM-7855](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-7855)), but for now it replicates the current implementation. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7595]Update execution-model.md
body:
In https://beam.apache.org/documentation/execution-model/, in Serialization and communication, the lists of possible transfer methods were formatted as numbered lists instead of bulleted lists. Numbered lists are appropriate for sequential lists, as a set of instructions **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-8238] Improve python gen_protos script
body:
I fixed the following issues with gen_protos that I encountered while developing: - script doesn't print output to shell when run during `python setup.py` - runs futurize twice when grcpio-tools is not present and needs to be installed - does not account for the case where there are more output files than .proto files (just keeps triggering out-of-date rebuilds due to timestamp of orphaned output file) - script runs twice for sdist, because sdist relies on egg_info, and both are wrapped - would be nice if script printed why it is regenerating pb2 files, since there are a number of possible reasons ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-5690] Fix Zero value issue with GroupByKey/CountByKey in SparkRunner
body:
With CountByKey transform in sparkRunner the expired window is not removed from the timer set. This causes the empty list to be present as value. 2019-09-12 21:46:57,384 [Executor task launch worker for task 510] TRACE org.apache.beam.runners.spark.stateful.SparkGroupAlsoByWindowViaWindowSet - SqlTransform/BeamAggregationRel_45/Group.CombineFieldsByFields/Group.ByFields/GroupByKey: output elements are TimestampedValueInSingleWindow{value=KV{Row:[90001], []}, timestamp=2019-09-12T16:15:59.999Z, window=[2019-09-12T16:15:00.000Z..2019-09-12T16:16:00.000Z), pane=PaneInfo{isFirst=true, isLast=true, timing=ON_TIME, index=0, onTimeIndex=0}} This causes zero values to be emitted whenever the watermark advances for the key. Issue can be reproduced using BeamSql (groupByKey) with SparkRunner also. Fix is provided to check if the timer has crossed the WindowBoundary + lateness, if so the timer is removed from SparkTimerInternals. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [Go SDK] - Direct Runner - Fix ParDo with side input after CoGroupByKey
body:
Using the Go SDK with direct runner, a `ParDo` taking as input the result of a `CoGroupByKey` and a side input was crashing at execution. After analysis, in direct mode, when the graph is being compiled, it adds buffering of the inbound inputs if the `ParDo` has side inputs ([see here](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/go/pkg/beam/runners/direct/direct.go#L245)). My changes make sure that the values from inbound streams are also cached. R: @lostluck
Crash stack trace

```go words := beam.CreateList(s, []string { "hello", "world", "hello" ,"world" }) wordsKeyed := beam.ParDo(s, func(word string) (string, string) { return word, word }, words) wordsCount := stats.Count(s, words) grouped := beam.CoGroupByKey(s, wordsKeyed, wordsCount) wordsWithCount := beam.ParDo(s, func(word string, wordIter func(*string) bool, countIter func(*int)bool, sideValue string) string { return fmt.Sprintf("%s %s", word, sideValue) }, grouped, beam.SideInput{Input:beam.Create(s, "some value")}) textio.Write(s, "out.txt", wordsWithCount) ```

title: [BEAM-8224] Fix bug in _fn_takes_side_inputs
body:
Bug was introduced in the conversion to inspect.signature, and manifests as assigning a wrapper function that accepts a single positional argument when the wrapped function can accept an arbitrary number. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7389] Generate notebook for filter
body:
First PR introducing the script to generate notebooks from docs using the `Filter` page as an example. R: @aaltay [script/code] R: @rosetn [writing/formatting] Staged: http://apache-beam-website-pull-requests.storage.googleapis.com/9561/documentation/transforms/python/elementwise/filter/index.html Notebook: https://colab.research.google.com/github/davidcavazos/beam/blob/notebook-filter/examples/notebooks/documentation/transforms/python/element-wise/filter-py.ipynb This is using the newly created [`md2ipynb`](https://github.com/davidcavazos/md2ipynb) package to generate the notebook files from Markdown. It's importing the license and setup instructions which are not present in the source Markdown docs, but needed in the notebook. It also adds links to back to the docs. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8098] Improve documentation on BigQueryIO
body:
While working on https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/9144, I realized there is a gap in BigQueryIO documentation on mapping between data types defined in BigQuery and in Beam SDK. For example, if a user reads a BYTES field from BigQuery into Beam, it will be represented as java.nio.ByteBuffer type in Beam Java SDK. The user will need to do an explicit type cast to ByteBuffer in order to use the data, but there is no easy way the user can know which type they should cast to, unless digging into BigQueryIO's implementation (Java - Avro - BigQuery). So I am adding a table here to make the type conversion clear. r: @pabloem ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8188] Allow PyArrow imports to fail on systems other than Win+Py27
body:
Allow PyArrow imports to fail on systems other than Windows running Python 2.7. As discussed in apache/beam#9522, PyArrow is not supported on more platforms than we had thought previously. Instead of adding additional special cases, we now allow PyArrow imports to fail on any platform. This is similar to what we already do for e.g. `tensorflow` and `google.cloud.pubsub`. R: @tvalentyn ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8191] Fixes potentially large number of tasks on Spark after Flatten.pCollections()
body:
In the Spark runner (Beam 2.14.0 and 2.15.0), a Flatten.pCollections() PTransform is translated into a Spark union operation. This union will create a potentially large number of partitions in the RDD that can overload the driver. This PR does a coalesce operation after the union, which will reduce the number of partitions in the RDD at virtually no cost. See the JIRA ticket for more detail: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-8191 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8164][website] Correct document for building the python SDK ha…
body:
The command `:sdks:python:container:docker` has been changed to `:sdks:python:container:buildAll` by the latest commit[1]. This pull requests fix all related places in our documents. Note: For the section (Adding dependencies, and making Python go vroom vroom) in CONTAINERS.md, it has totally outdated, e.g., the add_requirements.sh script can not work now and the dependent docker file has been removed. I think we can add python dependencies directly to the base_image_requirements.txt file and build the docker image if user need to add customized dependencies. title: [BEAM-8119] Properly cleanup Pubsub in release script
body:
Unexpected script failure will leak pubsub topics and fail the next run if no manual cleanup. We want to do cleanup every time before create the topics and also do cleanup when script exists. Tested manually. +R: @yifanzou ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8185] Properly backup sys config files in release script
body:
Following changes only affects Python mobilegaming varification in `run_rc_validation.sh`: - Add timestep to backup file name to make them unique (`~/.bashrc` and `~/.m2/settings.xml`) - Reorder m2 and bashrc config step. Move them out of python version loop since they are independent to Python version and only need to config once. This can avoid duplicate run which will overwrite backup files. - Reorder start data injection pipeline. Move it up and outside of python version loop so that all mobile gaming pipelines consume from its output. Originally, the script created one data injector per python version, which is unnecessary. Manual test from local machine. +R: @yifanzou @boyuanzz ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [go-sdk] Never split on the 0th element.
body:
That is, don't split if no elements have been processed yet. Always process at least one element so the primary split is never empty. body:
This will allow us to build and publish expansion service jars that can be used directly from Python without having to manually build and start them. (Having java installed will still be required, however.) Note that subprocess_server.py is a (refactored) move of what used to be in job_server.py. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-876] Support schemaUpdateOption in BigQueryIO
body:
# [BEAM-876] Support schemaUpdateOption in BigQueryIO This adds schemaUpdateOptions to `BigQueryIO.Write` so that one can specify these for BiqQuery when writing in batch mode. Usage example: ``` Write writer = BigQueryIO.writeTableRows() .to("name-goes-here") .withMethod(BigQueryIO.Write.Method.FILE_LOADS) .withWriteDisposition(BigQueryIO.Write.WriteDisposition.WRITE_APPEND) .withSchemaUpdateOptions(EnumSet.of(BigQueryIO.Write.SchemaUpdate.Option.ALLOW_FIELD_ADDITION)); ``` **Implementation Notes** *Hi, hello:* Hi all. I haven't contributed to this code base before, and am not super familiar with it. Style advice and such is super welcome. *Load vs Query Jobs in BigQuery:* BigQuery supports schema update side effects for load and query jobs. This implements support for load jobs only. In the context of Apache Beam, it doesn't seem like there's much utility to supporting queries which write to a table directly (as opposed to reading via a query and writing later in the pipeline). (Open to discussion/correction of course). *Avoiding Changing WriteTables Constructor:* I've added this to `WriteTables` with a `withSchemaUpdateOptions` method so as not to perturb the public constructor with an optional parameter. There's some awkwardness there -- but it seemed preferable to breaking the api or adding a secondary constructor. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-7013] Use a 0-length byte array to represent empty sketch in HllCount
body:
The current implementation of `HllCount.Init` and `HllCount.MergePartial` returns an empty `PCollection` when its input is empty. This is not ideal because, for example, if they are followed by a `HllCount.Extract` then the output `PCollection` will also be empty, but the result we really want is a `PCollection` of a single value `0`. Therefore, this PR is changing the behavior of empty aggregation such that it returns an "empty sketch" (represented by an empty `byte[]` of length 0), and also `HllCount.Extract` to handle it. The reason why we don't use `null` to represent "empty sketch" is, in short: 1) Space-efficiency: We will have to override the default `ByteArrayCoder`, and use a `NullableCoder` of `ByteArrayCoder` to encode the output, which is less efficient in terms of space because it needs to encode the information of whether the element is `null` 2) Safety: `null` values may cause problem in downstream transforms r: @zfraa @boyuanzz ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Remove superclass constructor call in PTransform.
body:
`PTransform` inherits from two classes `WithTypeHints`, `HasDisplayData`, both of which are intended to be mixins. Mixins typically cannot be used on their own and don't have a constructor. `WithTypeHints` does have a constructor, which may create an impression that it is more than a mixin, however this constructor is not required since the only initialized field will also be lazily initialized in `_get_or_create_type_hints`. `WithTypeHints.__init__()` also doesn't call `super(WithTypeHints, self).__init__()`, which means that `super(PTransform, self).__init__()` invocation stops at `WithTypeHints`, and doesn't proceed to other classes in `PTransform.__mro__`. The behavior and expectations in super/subclasses of PTransform would be more consistent if all of them follow the same contract of not calling `super()`. Removing `__init__` call in `PTransform` may be a clear signal that subclasses of PTransform are also not required to call constructor of PTransform. Such calls are not (usually not?) necessary, however this may not be evident, and prompt users of PTransform to create additional boilerplate, such as: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/tfrecordio.py#L217 . Subclassess of PTransform in Beam codebase do not always call constructor of PTransform, for example: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/393396b7ea4e896ef179758f9a4c0675f7cb8ff0/sdks/python/apache_beam/transforms/core.py#L1912, https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/483b9fbcae0dca3a492284169b64f7cea8d4c025/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery_file_loads.py#L550 don't call `super()`, which adds confusion whether this is necessary, so we may want to clean up calls to `PTransform.__init__()` in a future change. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-3713] Convert ITs to not use save_main_session
body:
This is a first step in migrating to pytest with the xdist plugin, which puts a module in the main session (execnet) that doesn't support pickling. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).
